value.title: Age Calculation in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Power Query has a simple way of calculating the age. However, because DAX is the popular language in many calculations in Power BI, many are not aware of this function in Power Query. In this video, I am going to show you how easy is to calculate Age in Power BI using Power BI. This method is very useful
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/a4kPkOAYOvg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Build Your Own Power BI Audit Log; Usage Metrics Across the Entire Tenant
value.excerpt: Power BI dashboard and reports come with a usage metric, which you can see how users used this content. There is also another usage metrics across the entire tenant, which you can see it if you have access to Power BI Administrator account, under Admin Panel in the Power BI Service. However, what if

Let’s say you have to columns: Cost, and Sales, and in one chart, you want to show only one of the measures above, but the selection

value.title: Export the Data of a Power BI table entirely in a few Clicks
value.excerpt: If you want to export the data of a Power BI table, you have options such as copy and paste, or putting it in a visual and export it. However, there is an easier way available too. You can use Power BI Helper (free tool) to export the entire data of the table. The instruction below explains how it is

value.title: Power BI DAX   Previous Month to Date, Quarter to Date, and Year to Date Calculations
value.excerpt: If you want to compare the sales up to a particular day and compare it with the previous period (month, quarter, or year) but up to that particular day in that period, then it is called previous month-to-date, previous quarter-to-date, and previous year-to-date. These calculations can be more helpful

value.title: Power BI Incremental Refresh and Hybrid Tables
value.excerpt: The default configuration for the Power BI dataset is to wipe out the entire data and reload it again. This can be a long process if you have a big dataset. Hybrid tables in Power BI keep part of the data in DirectQuery, and the rest is imported for data freshness and performance. In this video, I explain
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/2husIX__ZWg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Shared Datasets: What is it, How does it work, and Why should you care?
value.excerpt: Have you ever had a situation where you want to re-use part of the model in another report? Imagine two report visualizers in your team who want to create Power BI report visualizations from your data model. You have already done some modeling and calculations. How can this be done the best way without

value.title: Power BI Visualization Tip   Hide or Lock the Filter for Users
value.excerpt: I have previously explained that we have three scopes of filtering in the Power BI visualization. The filter created in the filter pane can be often changed or viewed by the user. However, there is a simple way to hide or lock it from the user. In this article and video, I explain how that works. Read

value.title: Replace BLANK with Zero in Power BI Visuals Such as Card
value.excerpt: If you use a field in a visual and based on a combination of slicer selection, that field doesn't have any value, you might see blank in the visual. If you want to replace that blank to zero, here is a trick for you. a very simple trick that you can use anywhere easily. Read more details in my blog post,

value.excerpt: When applying text transformations in Power BI using Power Query; two very important transformations that can help are; Trim and Clean. value.title: Introduction to data analytics on Azure
value.excerpt: Introduction to data analytics on Azure

topItems.title: Explore Azure data services for modern analytics
topItems.excerpt: Understand analytics solutions in the Azure data ecosystem. Explore the architecture of a scalable analytics solution to meet business needs.

topItems.title: Understand concepts of data analytics
topItems.excerpt: Explore key concepts of data analytics, including types of analytics, data, and storage. Explore the analytics process and tools used to discover insights.

topItems.title: Explore data analytics at scale
topItems.excerpt: Describe data analytics at scale and understand the roles of a data team. Learn about the responsibilities of an enterprise data analyst and what tools are available to build scalable solutions.
